values.text:
SIP is a method of investing a fixed sum, regularly, in a mutual fund scheme. SIP allows an investor to buy units regularly on a specific date of the month. This will help in building wealth in the long term.
You can use Systematic Investment Plan CalculatorCalculator

Health Insurance is a ‘must-to-have’ element for everyone. We offer you a hassle-free online health insurance policy that gives you ‘freedom from huge medical losses’. It empowers you with best medical assistance whether it is a physical damage or loss of health and supports you financially.

We offers Motor Insurance for various categories such as Car Insurance, Two Wheeler Policy, Commercial Vehicle Insurance, On Road-Protector Coverage, Value-Auto Coverage. Its primary use is to provide financial protection against physical damage or bodily injury resulting from traffic collisions and against liability that could also arise from incidents in a vehicle. Vehicle insurance may additionally offer financial protection against theft of the vehicle, and against damage to the vehicle sustained from events other than traffic collisions, such as keying, weather or natural disasters, and damage sustained by colliding with stationary objects.

values: Kindly specify the name of the company.

values.text:
When it comes to Mutual Funds, you can make money in three possible ways: Income earned from dividends on stocks and interest on bonds. A mutual fund pays out nearly all of the net income it receives over the year (in the form of a distribution). An increase in the price of securities (called a 'capital gain').
You can use Interest & Effective Rate of Return Calculator Calculator

A recurring deposit is a special kind of term deposit offered by banks in India which help people with regular incomes to deposit a fixed amount every month into their recurring deposit account and earn interest at the rate applicable to fixed deposits.
You can use Recurring Deposit Calculator Calculator

A fixed deposit (FD) is a financial instrument provided by banks or NBFCs which provides investors a higher rate of interest than a regular savings account, until the given maturity date. It may or may not require the creation of a separate account.
You can use Interest & Effective Rate of Return Calculator Calculator

SIP is a method of investing a fixed sum, regularly, in a mutual fund scheme. SIP allows an investor to buy units regularly on a specific date of the month. This will help in building wealth in the long term.
You can use Systematic Investment Plan CalculatorCalculator
